lines.gurmukhi: 1 mMglwcrx
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: siqguru scw pwiqswhu swDsMgiq scu KMfu vswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satiguru Sachaa Paatisaahu Saadhasangati Sachu Khandu Vasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The true Guru is true emperor who has founded the abode of truth in the  form of the congregation of the saints.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK lY gurisK hoie Awpu gvwie n Awpu gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Sikh Lai Gurasikh Hoi Aapu Gavaai N Aapu Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs living there being taught by the Guru, lose their ego and never make themselves noticed.

lines.gurmukhi: gurisK sBo swDnw swiD sDwie swDu sdvwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurasikh Sabho Saadhanaa Saadhi Sadhaai Saadhu Sadavaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The Sikhs  of the Guru get themselves called sadhus only after accomplishing all sorts  of discipline.

lines.gurmukhi: chu vrxw aupdys dy mwieAw ivic audwsu rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Chahu Varanaa Oupadays Day Maaiaa Vichi Udaasu Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They preach to all the four varnas and themselves remain  indifferent in the midst of maya.

lines.gurmukhi: schu ErY sB ikhu scu nwau gurmMqu idVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sachahu Aorai Sabhu Kihu Sachu Naau Guramantu Dirhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: They explain clearly that everything is  below truth i.e. the truth is highest and only this mantra should be recited  with deep integrity.

lines.gurmukhi: hukmY AMdir sB ko mMnY hukmu su sic smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Houkamai Andari Sabh Ko Mannai Houkamu Su Sachi Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Everything is subsumed in the divine order and  whosoever bows his head before His order, merges in the truth.

lines.gurmukhi: sbd suriq ilv AlKu lKwieAw ]1]
lines.transliteration_english: Sabad Surati Liv Alakhu Lakhaaiaa ?1?

Shabad OS B.translation: The  consciousness attuned to the Word makes man competent to behold the  invisible Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 2 do dI igxqI, gurmuK mihmwN

Shabad OS B.translation: Twosome,the glory of Gurmukh  ,

lines.gurmukhi: isv skqI no swiD kY cMdu sUrj idhuN rwiq sDwey
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Sakatee No Saadhi Kai Chandu Sooraju Dihoun Raati Sadhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering Siva and S'akti (the rajas and tamas qualities), the gurmukhs have disciplined the moon-sun (ira, pingala) and also the time known by days and nights.

lines.gurmukhi: suK duK swDy hrK sog nrk surg puMn pwp lMGwey
lines.transliteration_english: Soukh Doukh Saadhay Harakh Sog Narak Surag Pounn Paap Laghaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Subjugating pleasure and pain, joy and suffering, they  have gone beyond hell and heaven, sin and virtue.

lines.gurmukhi: jnm mrx jIvnu mukiq Blw burw imqRR sqRR invwey
lines.transliteration_english: Janam Maran Jeevanu Moukati Bhalaa Buraa Mitr Satr Nivaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They have humbled life,  death, liberation in life, right and wrong, enemy and friend.

lines.gurmukhi: rwj jog ijix vis kir swiD sMjog ivjogu rhwey
lines.transliteration_english: Raaj Jog Jini Vasi Kari Saadhi Sanjogu Vijogu Rahaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being victors  of raj and yoga (temporality and spirituality), they have disciplined alliance  as well as separation.

lines.gurmukhi: vsgiq kIqI nINd BUK Awsw mnsw ijix Gir Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Vasagati Keetee Neend Bhookh Aasaa Manasaa Jinee Ghari Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering sleep, hunger, hope and desire, they  have made their abode in their own true nature.

lines.gurmukhi: ausquiq inMdw swiD kY ihMdU muslmwx sbwey
lines.transliteration_english: Ousatati Nidaa Saadhi Kai Hindoo Mousalamaan Sabaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going beyond praise and  slander, they have become beloved of the Hindus as well as Muslims.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY pwKwk sdwey ]2]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Paa Khaak Sadaaay ?2?

Shabad OS B.translation: They  bow before all and consider themselves as dust.

lines.gurmukhi: 3 iqMn dI igxqI gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Threesome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: bHmw ibsnu mhysu qRRY lok vyd gux igAwn lMGwey
lines.transliteration_english: Brahamaa Bisanu Mahaysu Trai Lok Vayd Goun Giaan Laghaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs have gone ahead of the three worlds, three gunas (rajas,  sattva and tamas) and Brahma Visnu Mahesa.

lines.gurmukhi: BUq BivKhu vrqmwn Awid miD ijix AMiq isDwey
lines.transliteration_english: Bhoot Bhavikhahu Varatamaanu Aadi Madhi Jini Anti Sidhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They know the mystery of  the beginning, the middle, the end, of past, present and future.

lines.gurmukhi: mn bc krm iek`qRR kir jMmx mrx jIvx ijix Awey
lines.transliteration_english: Man Bach Karam Ikatr Kari Janman Maran Jeevan Jini Aaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: They keep  together in one line their mind, speech and action and conquer birth, life  and death.

lines.gurmukhi: AwiD ibAwiD aupwiD swiD surgimrq pwqwl invwey
lines.transliteration_english: Aadhi Biaadhi Oupaadhi Saadhi Surag Mirat Paataal Nivaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Subjugating all the maladies, they have humbled this world,  heaven and the nether world.

lines.gurmukhi: auqm mDm nIc swiD bwlk jobn ibriD ijxwey
lines.transliteration_english: Outamu Madham Neech Saadhi Baalak Joban Biradhi Jinaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Winning the top, middle and the lowest  positions they have conquered the childhood, youth and the old age.

lines.gurmukhi: ieVw ipMgulw suKmnw qiRkutI lMiG qiRbyxI nHwey
lines.transliteration_english: Irhaa Pingulaa Soukhamanaa Trikoutee Laghi Tribainee Nhaaay.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crossing  trikuti, the conjunction of three naris – ira, pingala, susumna in between the  eyebrows, they have bathed in the triveni, the pilgrimage centre at the  confluence of Ganges, Yamuna and Sarasvati.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK ieku mn iek iDAwey ]3]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Iku Mani Iku Dhiaaay ?3?

Shabad OS B.translation: With concentrated mind,  gurmukhs adore only one Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: 4 cOkVI dw vrxn, gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Four some-gurmukh  ,

lines.gurmukhi: AMfj jyrj swiD kY syqj auqBuj KwxI bwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Andaj Jayraj Saadhi Kai Saytaj Outabhuj Khaanee Baanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukhs  subdue the four life-mines (egg, foetus, sweat, vegetation)  and the four speeches (para, posyanti, madhyama, vaikhari~.

lines.gurmukhi: cwry kuMfw cwir jug cwir vrn cwir vyd vKwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaaray Koundaan Chaari Joug Chaari Varani Chaari Vaydu Vakhaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Four are  directions, four the yugas (ages), four varnas and four are the Vedas.

lines.gurmukhi: Drm ArQu kwmu moKu ijix rj qm sq gux qurIAw rwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Dharamu Aradu Kaamu Mokhu Jini Raj Tam Sat Goun Tureeaa Raanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering dharma, artha, kama, moksa and crossing three stagges of rajas,  sattva and tamas they enter into the fourth stage turiya, the stage of supreme  bliss.

lines.gurmukhi: snkwidk AwsRm aulMiG cwir vIr vsgiq kir AwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Sanakaadik Aasram Ulaghi Chaari Veer Vasagati Kari Aanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: They control Sanak, Sanandan Sanatan, Sanatkumar, the four  ashramas and the four warriors (in the field of charity, dharma, compassion  and warfare).

lines.gurmukhi: caupiV ijau causwr mwir joVw hoie n koie r\\\\wxI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaouparhi Jiu Chaousaar Maari Jorhaa Hoi N Koi Raanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As in chaupar (a game like blackgamman played with an  oblong dice) one is victorious by winning all the four sides, and a twosome  is not killed,

lines.gurmukhi: rMg ibrMg qMbol rs bhu rMgI ieku rMgu nIswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Rang Birang Tanbol Ras Bahu Rangee Iku Rangu Neesaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: As in chaupar (a game like blackgamman played with an  oblong dice) one is victorious by winning all the four sides, and a twosome  is not killed,

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK swDsMgiq inrbwxI ]4]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Nirabaanee ?4?

Shabad OS B.translation: So the gurmukh also makes pair with the One Lord and becomes  undefeatable.

lines.gurmukhi: 5 pMc hr sMKRXw gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Fivesome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: pauxu pwxI bYsMqro Driq Akwsu aulMiG pieAwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Paounu Paanee Baisantaro Dharati Akaasu Ulaghi Paiaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh goes beyond air, water, fire, earth and sky.

lines.gurmukhi: kwm kroDu ivroDu lMiG loBu mohu AhMkwr ivhwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Kaamu Krodhu Virodhu Laghi Lobhu Mohu Ahankaaru Vihaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Resisting lust and  anger he crosses the greed, infatuation and ego.

lines.gurmukhi: siq sMqoK dieAw Drmu ArQu su gRMQ pMc prvwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Sati Santokh Daiaa Dharamu Aradu Su Garandu Panch Paravaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He espouses truth,  contentment, compassion, dharma and fortitude.

lines.gurmukhi: Kycr BUcr cwcrI aunmn lMiG Agocr bwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Khaychar Bhoochar Chaacharee Ounaman Laghi Agochar Baanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting above of the  khechar bhuchar chachar, unman and agochar (all yogic postures) mudras  he concentrates upon the One Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pMcwiex prmysro pMc sbd GnGor nIswxw
lines.transliteration_english: Panchaain Paramaysaro Panch Sabad Ghanaghor Neesaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He beholds God in five (select persons)  and the five sounds of five words become his special marks.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK pMc BUAwqmw swDsMgiq imil swD suhwxw
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Panch Bhooaatamaa Saadhasangati Mili Saadh Suhaanaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Antahkaran,  the basis of all five external elements is cultivated and cultured by gurmukh  in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: shj smwiD n Awvx jwxw ]5]
lines.transliteration_english: Sahaj Samaadhi N Aavan Jaanaa ?5?

Shabad OS B.translation: This way immersing in undisturbed trance he  gets liberated from the cycle of transmigration.

lines.gurmukhi: 6 Cy dI igxqI gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Sixsome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: iCA ruqI kir swDnwN iCA drsn swDY gurmqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Routee Kari Saadhanaan Chhia Darasan Saadhai Guramatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Attaining spiritual discipline through the six seasons, gurmukh assimilates  even the six philosophies.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA rs rsnw swiD kY rwg rwgxI Bwie BgqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Ras Rasanaa Saadi Kai Raag Raaganee Bhaai Bhagatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He conquers the six tastes (sour, sweet,  astringent, bitter, tart and saltish) of the tongue and alongwith six musical  measures and their consorts surrenders with full devotions.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA icrjIvI iCA jqI c`kÍriq iCA swiQ jugqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Chirajeevee Chhia Jatee Chakravarati Chhia Saadhi Jougatee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He understands  and accomplishes the ways of life of six immortal ones, six yatis (ascetics)  and six yogic chakras.

lines.gurmukhi: iCA swsqR iCA krm ijix iCAw gurwN gur suriq inrqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Saasatr Chhia Karam Jini Chhia Guraan Gur Surati Niratee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering the six codes of conduct and the six  philosophies, he cultivates friendship with the six gurus (teachers of these  philosophies).

lines.gurmukhi: iCA vrqwry swiD kY iCA Ck CqI pvx prqI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhia Varataaray Saadhi Kai Chhia Chhak Chhatee Pavan Paratee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He turns his face from the five external organs plus one  internal organ, the mind, and their attendant thirty six kinds of hypocrisies.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq gur sbd surqI ]6]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Gur Sabad Suratee ?6?

Shabad OS B.translation: Reaching the holy congregation the consciousness of a gurmukh gets  absorbed in the Word of Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: 7 spq sMKRXw gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Sevensome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: sq smuMd aulMiGAw dIp sq iek dIpku bilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Samound Ulaghiaa Deep Sat Iku Deepaku Baliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting above of the seven oceans and seven Continents, the gurmukh lights  the lamp of knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: sq sUq iek sUq kir sqy purIAw lMiG auCilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Soot Ik Sooti Kari Satay Pureeaa Laghi Ouchhaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: He binds the seven threads (five organs, mind and  wisdom) of body into one thread (of high consciousness) and goes across  the seven (mythological) habitats (puris).

lines.gurmukhi: sq sqI ijix spq iriK siq surw ijix Atlu n tilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Satee Jini Sapat Rikhi Sati Suraa Jini Atalu Naa Taliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Understanding the intrinsic  meaning of seven satis, seven rishis and seven musical notes, he remains  steadfast in his resolves.

lines.gurmukhi: sqy sIvwN swiD kY sqIN sIvIN suPilE PilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satay Seevaan Saadhi Kai Sateen Seeveen Suphaliao Phaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crossing the seven stages of knowledge, gurmukh  gets the fruit of the knowledge of Brahm, the basis of all the stages.

lines.gurmukhi: sq Awkws pqwl sq visgiq kir aupryrY cilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sat Akaas Pataal Sat Vasigati Kari Ouparayrai Chaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Controlling the seven nether worlds and seven skies he goes beyond them.

lines.gurmukhi: sqy DwrI lMiGkY BYrau KyqRRpwl dl milAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satay Dhaaree Laghi Kai Bhairau Khaytrapaal Dal Maliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Getting across the seven streams, he decimates the armies of Bhairav and  other protectors of the worlds.

lines.gurmukhi: sqy rohix siq vwr siq suhwgix swD n FilAw
lines.transliteration_english: Satay Rohani Sati Vaar Sati Suhaagani Saadhi N Dphaliaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The seven rohinis  seven days and the seven  married women and their ritualistic activities cannot upset him.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK swDsMgiq ivic KilAw ]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Vichi Khaliaa ?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh  always remains stabilized in the true congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 8 ASt sMKRXw gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Eightsome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: ATY isDI swiD kY swiDk isD smwiD PlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Abhai Sidhee Saadhi Kai Saadhik Sidh Samaadhi Phalaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Accomplishing eight siddhis (powers) the gurmukh has attained the fruit of  adept trance (siddh samadhi).

lines.gurmukhi: Ast kulI ibKu swDnw ismrix syK n kImiq pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Asat Kulee Bikhu Saadhanaa Simarani Saykh N Keemati Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The practices by the eight ancestoral family  houses of Sesanag could not understand His mystery.

lines.gurmukhi: mxu huie AT pYsyrIAw pMjU ATy cwlIh BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Manu Hoi Atd Paisayreeaa Panjoo Atday Chaaleeh Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: One maund (old Indian  weighing unit) consists of eight panseris (about five kilograms), and five  multiplied by eight is equal to forty.

lines.gurmukhi: ijau crKw AT KMBIAw iekqu sUiq rhY ilvlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Jiu Charakhaa Atd Khanbheeaa Ikatu Sooti Rahai Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: The spinning wheel having eight spokes  keeps its consciousness concentrated in a single thread.

lines.gurmukhi: A`T pihr AstwNg jogu cwvl rqI mwsw rweI
lines.transliteration_english: Atd Pahir Asataangu Jogu Chaaval Ratee Maasaa Raaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eight watches, eight limbed yoga, chaval (rice), ratti, rais, masa (all old Indian measuring units of time and weight) have among themselves the relationship of eight i.e. eight  rais = one chaval, eight chavals = one ratti and  eight rattis = one masa.

lines.gurmukhi: AT kwTw mnu vs kir Ast Dwqu ieku Dwqu krweI
lines.transliteration_english: Atd Kaatdaa Manu Vas Kari Asat Dhaatu Iku Dhaatu Karaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Controlling the mind comprising eight  inclinations, the gurmukh has made it homogenous as the eight metals after  mixing become one metal.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq vfI vifAweI ]8]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Vadee Vadiaaee ?8?

Shabad OS B.translation: Great is the glory of the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: 9 nv sMKRXw-gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Ninesome-gurmukh -

lines.gurmukhi: niQ clwey nvY nwiQ nwQw nwQ AnwQ shweI
lines.transliteration_english: Nadi Chalaaay Navai Naadi Naadaa Naadu Anaad Sahaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Though, the gurmukh subdues the nine naths (ascetic yogis) yet he considers  himself as without any father i.e. most humble, and God as the father of the  fatherless ones.

lines.gurmukhi: nau inDwn Purmwn ivic prm inDwn igAwn gurBweI
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Nidhaan Phuramaan Vichi Param Nidhaan Giaan Gurabhaaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Nine treasures are in his command and the great ocean of  knowledge goes with him like his brother.

lines.gurmukhi: nau BgqI nau Bgiq kir gurmuiK pRym Bgiq ilvlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Bhagatee Nau Bhagati Kari Guramoukhi Praym Bhagati Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Neo devotees practise nine  types of ritualistic devotion but gurmukh remains immersed in the loving  devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: nau giH swD giHsq ivic pUry siqgur dI vifAweI
lines.transliteration_english: Naougrih Saadh Grihasat Vichi Pooray Satigur Dee Vadiaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: With the blessings of the Guru and living the household life, he controls all the nine planets.

lines.gurmukhi: nauKMf swD AKMf hoie nau duAwir lMiG inj Gir jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Naoukhand Saadh Akhand Hoi Nau Duaari Laghi Nij Ghari Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even conquering the nine divisions of earth,  he never gets broken up and, going above the illusions of nine doors of  body, hecomes to reside in his own self.

lines.gurmukhi: nau AMg nIl AnIl hoie nau kul ingH shij smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Nau Ang Neel Aneel Hoi Nau Kul Nigrah Sahaji Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: From nine numbers have been  counted infinite numbers, and controlling the nine pleasures (ras) in the  body, gurmukh stays in the equipoise.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuK suK Plu AlKu lKweI ]9]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Alakhu Lakhaaee ?9?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only gurmukhs receive the  unattainable fruit of the supreme delight.

lines.gurmukhi: 10 ds sMKRXw-gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Tensome-gurmukh -

lines.gurmukhi: sMinAwsI ds nwv Dir sc nwv ivxu nwv gxwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sanniaasee Das Naav Dhari Sach Naav Vinu Naav Ganaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Sannyasis, giving ten nomenclatures to their sects, but in fact being devoid  of the true Name have (egotistically) got their own names counted.

lines.gurmukhi: ds Avqwr Akwru kir eykMkwr n AlKu lKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Das Avataar Akaaru Kari Aykankaaru N Alakhu Lakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even the ten incarnations when they came in (human) form did not see that  invisible Oankar.

lines.gurmukhi: qIrQ purb sMjog ivic ds purbIN gurpurib n pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Teerad Purab Sanjog Vichi Das Purabeen Gur Purabi N Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Celebrations of the ten auspicious days (no-moon, full  moon days etc.) at pilgrimage centres could not know the real importance  of Gurpurb, the anniversaries of the Gurus.

lines.gurmukhi: iek mn iek n cyiqE swDsMgiq ivxu dhidis DwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Mani Ik N Chaytiao Saadhasangati Vinu Dahadisi Dhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The individual did not ponder  upon the Lord with his concentrated mind and bereft of the holy congregation  he is running in all the ten directions.

lines.gurmukhi: ds dihAwN ds AsÍmyD Kwie AmyD inKyDu krwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Das Daheeaan Das Asamaydh Khaai Amaydh Nikhaydhu Karaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Ten days of Muslim Muharram and  ten horse sacrifices (asvamedh) are prohibited in Gurmat (Sikhism).

lines.gurmukhi: ieMdrIAw ds vis kir bwhir jwNdw vrij rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Indareeaan Das Vasi Kari Baahari Jaandaa Varaji Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh, controlling the ten organs stops the mind racing in ten directions.

lines.gurmukhi: pYrI pY jgu pYrI pwieAw ]10]
lines.transliteration_english: Pairee Pai Jag Pairee Paaiaa ?10?

Shabad OS B.translation: He humbly bows at the Guru's feet and the whole world falls at his feet.

lines.gurmukhi: 11 eykwdS sMKRXw-gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Elevensome-gurmukh -

lines.gurmukhi: iek min hoie iekwdsI gurmuiK vrqu piqbRiq BwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Ik Mani Hoi Ikaadasee Guramoukhi Varatu Patibrati Bhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like a faithful wife, gurmukh likes the fast of ekadasi in the form of  concentration of mind (Hindus generally observe fast on the eleventh day  of lunar month).

lines.gurmukhi: igAwrh rudRR smudR ivic pl dw pwrwvwr n pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaarah Rudr Samudr Vichi Pal Daa Paaraavaaru N Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Eleven Rudras (different forms of Siva) could not  understand the mystery of this world - ocean.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwrh ks igAwrh ksy kis ksv`tI ks kswieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaarah Kas Giaarah Kasay Kasi Kasavatee Kas Kasaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The gurmukh has controlled  all the eleven (ten organs and the mind). Their eleven objects also he has  controlled and he has purified the mind-gold by rubbing it on the touchstone  of devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwrh gux PYlwau kir kc pkweI AGV GVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaarah Goun Dhailaau Kari Kach Pakaaee Agharh Gharhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Cultivating eleven virtues he has chiselled and stabilized the  tardy mind.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwrh dwau cVHwau kir dUjw Bwau kudwau rhwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaarah Daau Charhhaau Kari Doojaa Bhaau Kudaau Rahaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Assuming eleven virtues (truth, contentment, compassion,  dharma, control, devotion etc.) he has erased duality and dubiousness.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwrh gyVw isKu suix gur isKu lY gurisKu sdwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaarah Gayrhaa Sikhu Souni Gur Sikhu Lai Gurasikhu Sadaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Listening to the mantra eleven times, the gurmukh adopting the teaching of  the Guru, is called Gursikh.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq guru sbdu vswieAw ]11]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Guru Sabadu Vasaaiaa ?11?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy congregation only the Word-Guru  resides in one's heart.

lines.gurmukhi: 12 dÍwdS sMKRXw gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Twelvesome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh pMQ sDwiekY gurmuiK gwfI rwh clwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Pand Sadhaai Kai Guramoukhi Gaadee Raah Chalaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Winning over the twelve sects of yogis, the gurmukhs started a simple and  straight way (for liberation).

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj bwrh mwh ivic ssIAru iekqu mwih iPrwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Baarah Maah Vichi Saseearu Ikatu Maahi Dhiraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: It looks as if the sun circumambulates earth  in twelve months and the moon in one month but the fact is that the work  completed by the person having tamas and rajas qualities in twelve months  is done in one month by the person having sattva quality.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh solh myil kir ssIAr AMdir sUr smwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Solah Mayli Kari Saseear Andari Soor Samaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Combining twelve  (months) and sixteen (phases of moon) the sun merges into the moon i.e. rajas and tamas get absobed into the sattva.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh iqlk imtwiekY gurmuiK iqlku nIswxu cVwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Tilak Mitaai Kai Guramoukhi Tilaku Neesaanu Charhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh repudiating the twelve  types of marks on forehead only keeps on his head the mark of the love of  Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh rwsI swiD kY sic rwis rhrwis luBwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Raasee Saadhi Kai Sachi Raasi Raharaasi Loubhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Conquering the twelve zodiac signs, gurmukh remains absorbed in  the capital of truthful conduct.

lines.gurmukhi: bwrh vMnI hoie kY bwrh mwsy qoil qulwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Baarah Vannee Hoi Kai Baarah Maasay Toli Tulaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Becoming pure gold of twelve masas (twenty  four carrots) they come true to their worth in the world market.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrs pwris pris krwieAw ]12]
lines.transliteration_english: Paaras Paarasi Parasi Karaaiaa ?12?

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching  the philosopher's stone in the form of Guru, the gunnukhs also become  philosopher's stone.

lines.gurmukhi: 13 qRRRXodS sMKRXw gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Thirteensome-gurmukh

lines.gurmukhi: qyrh qwl AaUirAw gurmuiK suK qp qwl purwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tayrah Taal Aooriaa Guramoukh Soukh Tapu Taal Puraaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thirteen beats of music are incomplete but gurmukh with his accomplishment  of the rythm (of household life) attains delight.

lines.gurmukhi: qyrh rqn AkwrQy gur aupdysu rqnu Dnu pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tayrah Ratan Akaaraday Gur Oupadaysu Ratanu Dhanu Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thirteen jewels are also  futile for the Gurmukh who gets the jewel of teaching of the Guru.

lines.gurmukhi: qyrh pd kir jg ivic ipqr krm kir Brim BulwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Tayrah Pad Kari Jag Vichi Pitari Karam Kari Bharami Bhulaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  ritualistic people have overawed the people in their thirteen types of rituals.

lines.gurmukhi: lK lK jg n pujnI gurisK crxodk pIAwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Lakh Jag N Pujanee Gurasikh Charanodak Peeaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Myriad burnt offerings (yajna) cannot be equated with nectar of the feet of  gurmukh.

lines.gurmukhi: jg Bog neIvyd lK gurmuiK muiK ieku dwxw pwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Jag Bhog Naeevayd Lakh Guramoukhi Moukhi Iku Daanaa Paaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Even one grain of gurmukh;s is equal to millions of yajnas,  offerings and edibles.

lines.gurmukhi: gurBweI sMqustu kir gurmuiK suK Plu iprm cKwieAw
lines.transliteration_english: Gurabhaaee Santousatu Kari Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piramu Chakhaaiaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: And by making their fellow disciples of the Guru  content, the Gurmukhs remain happy.

lines.gurmukhi: Bgiq vClu hoie ACl ClwieAw ]13]
lines.transliteration_english: Bhagati Vachhalu Hoi Achhalu Chhalaaiaa ?13?

Shabad OS B.translation: God is undeceivable but He is dodged  by the devotees.

lines.gurmukhi: 14 14 -15 -16 dI igxqI-gurmuK

Shabad OS B.translation: Fourteen,Fifteen and Sixteensome-gurmukh14 -15 -16  -

lines.gurmukhi: caudh ividAw swiDkY gurmiq Aibgiq AkQ khwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudah Vidiaa Saadhi Kai Guramati Abigati Akad Kahaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Accomplishing the fourteen skills, gurmukhs adopt the indescribable skill  of the wisdom of Guru (Gurmat).

lines.gurmukhi: caudh Bvx aulMiGkY inj Gir vwsu nyhu inrbwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Chaudah Bhavan Ulaghi Kai Nij Ghari Vaasu Nayhu Nirabaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Going across the fourteen worlds they  reside in their own self and remain immersed in the state of nirvana.

lines.gurmukhi: pMdH iQqI pKu ieku kiRsn sukl duie p`K nIswxI
lines.transliteration_english: Pandrah Ditee Pakhu Iku Krisan Soukal Dui Pakh Neesaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: One  fortnight consists of fifteen days; one is the dark (krsna) fortnight and the  second is moonlit light (sukla)fortnight.

lines.gurmukhi: solh swr sMGwru kir joVw juiVAw inrBau jwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Solah Saar Sanghaaru Kari Jorhaa Jurhiaa Nirabhau Jaanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Like the game of dice, ousting the  sixteen counters and making the pair only, one attains fearlessness.

lines.gurmukhi: solh klw sMpUrxo sis Gir sUrju ivrqI hwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Solah Kalaa Sanpoorano Sasi Ghari Sooraju Viratee Haanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: When  moon, the master of sixteen phases (full of sattvic quality) enters into the  sun (full of rajas and tamas), it gets faded.

lines.gurmukhi: nwir solh sINgwr kir syj Bqwr iprm rsu mwxI
lines.transliteration_english: Naari Solah Seengaar Kari Sayj Bhataar Piram Rasu Maanee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Woman also using sixteen  types of adornments goes to the bed of her husband and enjoys the extreme  delight.

lines.gurmukhi: isv qY skiq sqwrh vwxI ]14]
lines.transliteration_english: Siv Tai Sakati Sataarah Vaanee ?14?

Shabad OS B.translation: The power (sakti) of Siva i.e. maya keeps with her seventeen  speeches or variations of its powers.

lines.gurmukhi: 15 18 qoN 34 q`k sMKRXw

Shabad OS B.translation: Eighteen to thirty-four18  34

lines.gurmukhi: goq ATwrh soiDkY pVY purwx ATwrh BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Got Atdaarah Sodhi Kai Parhai Puraan Atdaarah Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Thoroughly understanding the eighteen gotras, sub castes, the gurmukhs  go through the eighteen puranas.

lines.gurmukhi: aunI vIh iekIh lMiG bweI aumry swiD invweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ounee Veeh Ikeeh Laghi Baaee Oumaray Saadhi Nivaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Jumping over nineteen, twenty and twenty-one.

lines.gurmukhi: sMK AsMK lutwiekY qyeI cOvI pMjIh pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Sankh Asankh Loutaai Kai Tayee Chauvee Panjeeh Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: They make the number of twenty-three, twenty-four and twenty-five  meaningful.

lines.gurmukhi: CbI joiV sqweIhw Awie ATweIh myl imlweI
lines.transliteration_english: Chhabee Jorhi Sataaeehaa Aai Atdaaeeh Mayli Milaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the name of twenty-six, twenty-seven, twenty-eight they  meet the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: aulMiG auxqIh qIh swiD lMiG iekqIh vjI vDweI
lines.transliteration_english: Ulaghi Ounateeh Teeh Saadhi Laghi Ikateeh Vajee Vadhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Crossing twenty-nine, thirty and reaching thirty-one, in  their heart they feel blest and delighted.

lines.gurmukhi: swD sulKx bqIhy qyqIh DRU cauPyir iPrweI
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sulakhan Bateehay Tayteeh Dhr Chaudhayri Dhiraaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Accomplishing the thirty-two saintly  characteristics, like Dhru they make thirty-three crore gods and goddesses shake and revolve around (them).

lines.gurmukhi: cauqIh lyK AlyK lKweI ]15]
lines.transliteration_english: Chaouteeh Laykh Alaykh Lakhaaee ?15?

Shabad OS B.translation: Touching thirty-four they realize the  Invisible Lord i.e. the gurmukhs going above all the numbers get exhilerated in the love of Lord who is beyond all the counts.

lines.gurmukhi: 16 eISÍropmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of the lord

lines.gurmukhi: vyd kqybhu bwhrw lyK AlyK n liKAw jweI
lines.transliteration_english: Vayd Kataybahu Baaharaa Laykh Alaykh N Lakhiaa Jaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: God is beyond Vedas and katebas (holy books of Semitic religions) and He  cannot be visualized.

lines.gurmukhi: rUp AnUpu Acrju hY drsnu diRsit Agocr BweI
lines.transliteration_english: Roopu Anoopu Acharaju Hai Darasanu Drisati Agochar Bhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: His form is grand and awe-inspiring. He is beyond  the reach of body organs.

lines.gurmukhi: ieku kvwau pswau kir qoln qulwDwr n smweI
lines.transliteration_english: Iku Kavaau Pasaau Kari Tolu N Tulaadhaar N Samaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He created this cosmos by His one big bang  which cannot be weighed on any scale.

lines.gurmukhi: kQnI bdnI bwhrw QkY sbdu suriq ilv lweI
lines.transliteration_english: Kadanee Badanee Baaharaa Dakai Sabadu Surati Liv Laaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: He is indescribable and many a  man in order to reach Him has got tired by putting their consciousness into  the Word.

lines.gurmukhi: mn bc krm Agocrw miq buiD swiD soJI Qik pweI
lines.transliteration_english: Man Bach Karam Agocharaa Mati Budhi Saadhi Sojhee Daki Paaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Being beyond the ken of mind, speech, and action, the wisdom,  intellect and all practices have also left hope of catching hold of Him.

lines.gurmukhi: ACl ACyd AByd hY Bgiq vClu swDsMgiq CweI
lines.transliteration_english: Achhal Achhayd Abhayd Hai Bhagati Vachhalu Saadhasangati Chhaaee.

Shabad OS B.translation: Undeceivable, beyond time and non dual, the Lord is kind to devotees  and pervades through the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: vfw Awp vfI vifAweI ]16]
lines.transliteration_english: Vadaa Aapi Vadee Vadiaaee ?16?

Shabad OS B.translation: He is great and His grandeur  is also great

lines.gurmukhi: 17 gurmuK suK Pl

Shabad OS B.translation: Gurmukh and fruits of delight

lines.gurmukhi: vx vx ivic vxwspiq rhY aujwiV AMdir AvswrI
lines.transliteration_english: Van Van Vichi Vanaasapati Rahai Ujaarhi Andari Avasaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The vegetation in the desolate places in the forest remains unknown.

lines.gurmukhi: cuix cuix AwNjin bUtIAw piqswhI bwg lwie svwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Chouni Chouni Aanjani Booteeaa Patisaahee Baagu Laai Savaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: The  gardeners choose and pick up some plants and plant them in the garden of  the kings.

lines.gurmukhi: isMij isMij ibrK vfIrIAin swir smHwil krn vIcwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Sinji Sinji Birakh Vadeereeani Saari Samhaali Karan Veechaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: They are grown by irrigation, and the thoughtful persons take  care of them.

lines.gurmukhi: hoie sPl ruiq AweIAY AMmiRq Pl AMmiRq rs BwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Honi Saphal Routi Aaeeai Anmrit Phalu Anmrit Rasu Bhaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the season they fructify and offer juicy fruits.

lines.gurmukhi: ibrKhu swau n AwveI Pl ivic swau sugMiD sMjwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Birakhahu Saau N Aavaee Phal Vichi Saau Sougandhi Sanjaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: There is no  taste in the tree but in fruit resides taste as well as flavour.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm jgqRR ivic gurmuiK swDsMgiq inrMkwrI
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Jagatr Vichi Guramoukhi Saadhasangati Nirankaaree.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the world,  the perfect Brahm resides in holy congregation of the gurmukhs.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Pl Apr ApwrI ]17]
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Apar Apaaree ?17?

Shabad OS B.translation: In fact,  the gurmukhs themselves are the infinite pleasure-giving fruit in the world.

lines.gurmukhi: 18 AMbr vrxn

Shabad OS B.translation: The sky

lines.gurmukhi: AMbr ndrI AwNvdw kyvfu vfw koie n jwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Anbaru Nadaree Aanvadaa Kayvadu Vadaa Koi N Jaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: The sky is seen but none knows its extent.

lines.gurmukhi: aucw kyvfu AwKIAY suMn srUp n AwiK vKwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Ouchaa Kayvadu Aakheeai Sounn Saroop N Aakhi Vakhaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: How much high it is in the form  of vaccum is not known to anybody.

lines.gurmukhi: lYin aufwrI pMKxU Anl mnl auif Kbir n AwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Laini Udaaree Pankhanoo Anal Manal Udi Khabari N Aanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Birds fly in it and even the anal bird  which always remains flying does not know the mystery of sky.

lines.gurmukhi: EVku mUil n lBeI sBy hoie iPrin hYrwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Aorhiku Mooli N Labhaee Sabhay Hoi Dhirani Hairaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Mystery  of its origin is not known to any body and all are wonder-struck.

lines.gurmukhi: lK Agws n ApVin kudriq kwdr no kurbwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Lakh Agaas N Aparhani Kudarati Kaadaru No Kurabaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: I am  sacrifice unto His Nature; even millions of skies cannot express His  grandeur.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm siqgur purKu swDsMgiq vwsw inrbwxY
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabraham Satigur Purakhu Saadhasangati Vaasaa Nirabaanai.

Shabad OS B.translation: That true Lord resides in the holy congregation.

lines.gurmukhi: murdw hoie murId is\\\\wxY ]18]
lines.transliteration_english: Muradaa Hoi Mureedu Siaanai ?18?

Shabad OS B.translation: Only a devotee  who becomes dead from the point of view of ego, can identify him.

lines.gurmukhi: 19 gur mihmw

Shabad OS B.translation: Praises of the Guru

lines.gurmukhi: gur mUriq pUrn bHm Git Git AMdir sUrj suJY
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Moorati Pooran Brahamu Ghati Ghati Andari Sooraju Sujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru is the replica of the perfect Brahm, who like the sun is illuminating all  hearts.

lines.gurmukhi: sUrj kvlu prIq hY gurmuiK pRym Bgiq kir buJY
lines.transliteration_english: Sooraj Kavalu Pareeti Hai Guramoukhi Praym Bhagati Kari Bujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: As the lotus loves the sun so is the gurmukh who through loving  devotion knows the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: pwrbHm gur sbd hY inJr Dwr vrHY gux guJY
lines.transliteration_english: Paarabrahamu Gur Sabadu Hai Nijhar Dhaar Varhai Goun Gujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Word of the Guru is the perfect Brahm who as a  one current of all the qualities flows eternally through one and all.

lines.gurmukhi: ikriK ibrKu hoie sPlu Pl cMdn vws invws n KuJY
lines.transliteration_english: Kirakhi Birakhu Hoi Saphalu Phali Channani Vaasu Nivaasu N Khujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Because  of that current, plants and trees grow and give flowers and fruits, and the  sandal also becomes fragrant.

lines.gurmukhi: APl sPl smdrs hoie mohu n Doh n duibDw luJY
lines.transliteration_english: Aphal Saphal Samadaras Hoi Mohu N Dhohu N Doubidhaa Lujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Whether some are fruitless or full of fruit, all become equally unbiased. Infatuation and dubiety do not put them to  trouble.

lines.gurmukhi: gurmuiK suK Plu iprm rsu jIvn mukiq Bugiq kir duJY
lines.transliteration_english: Guramoukhi Soukh Phalu Piram Rasu Jeevan Moukati Bhagati Kari Dujhai.

Shabad OS B.translation: Liberation in life and supreme delight, gurmukh gets through  devotion.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq imil shij smuJY ]19]
lines.transliteration_english: Saadhasangati Mili Sahaji Samujhai ?19?

Shabad OS B.translation: In the holy congregation the state of equipoise is actually identified  and known.

lines.gurmukhi: 20 gur sbd

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru-Word

lines.gurmukhi: sbd gurU guru jwxIAY gurmuiK hoie suriq Duin cylw
lines.transliteration_english: Sabadu Guroo Guru Jaaneeai Guramoukhi Hoi Surati Dhouni Chaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: One should accept the word of the Guru as the Guru, and by becoming gurmukh  one makes his consciousness the disciple of the Word.

lines.gurmukhi: swDsMgiq scKMf ivic pRym Bgiq prcY hoie mylw
lines.transliteration_english: Saadh Sangati Sachakhand Vichi Praym Bhagati Parachai Hoi Maylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: When one becomes  attached to the abode of truth in the form of holy congregation, he through  loving devotion meets the Lord.

lines.gurmukhi: igAwnu iDAwnu ismrx jugiq kUMj kurm hMs vMsu nvylw
lines.transliteration_english: Giaanu Dhiaanu Simaranu Jougati Koonj Karam Hans Vans Navaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: In the art of knowledge, meditation and  rememberance, the Siberian crane, tortoise and swan respectively are adept  ones (in gurmukh all these three qualities are found).

lines.gurmukhi: ibrKhuN Pl Pl qy ibrKu gurisK isK gur mMq suhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Birakhahoun Phal Phal Tay Birakhu Gurasikh Sikh Gur Mantu Suhaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: As from tree the fruit  and from fruit (seed) again the tree is grown i.e. (tree and fruit are the same),  so is the simple philosophy that the Guru and the Sikh are the same.

lines.gurmukhi: vIhwN AMdir vrqmwn hoie iekIh Agocru Kylw
lines.transliteration_english: Veehaa Andari Varatamaan Hoi Ikeeh Agocharu Khaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Word  of the Guru is present in the world but beyond this is the ekankar (ikis)  occupied in His invisible game (of creation and destruction).

lines.gurmukhi: Awid purKu Awdysu kir Awid purK Awdys vhylw
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Purakhu Aadaysu Kari Aadi Purakh Aadays Vahaylaa.

Shabad OS B.translation: Bowing before  that primeval Lord that power of the Word in His hukam merges into Him.

lines.gurmukhi: isPiq slwhxu AMmiRq vylw ]20]
lines.transliteration_english: Sidhati Salaahanu Anmritu Vaylaa ?20?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Ambrosial hours are the correct time for His praise.

lines.gurmukhi: <> siqgur pRswid ]
lines.transliteration_english: Ikonkaar Satigur Prasaadi ?

Shabad OS B.translation: One Oankar, the primal energy, realized through the grace of divine preceptor

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm ibbyk Awpw Awp pRgws huie
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Bibayka , Aapaa Aap Pragaas Hui ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Being supreme conscious and knowledgeable; it seems God Himself has descended as light divine in the form of Guru Hargobind.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm doie pRB eyk gur goibMd bKwnIAY ]1]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Doi Prabh Ayka , Gur Gobind Bakhaaneeai ?1?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: One may hold them (Guru Hargobind) and Gobind different due to their names, but in reality, God Himself has appeared in the form of Hargobind.

lines.gurmukhi: Awpw Awp pRgws hoie pUrn bHm ibbyk
lines.transliteration_english: Aapaa Aap Pragaas Hoi , Pooran Braham Bibayk ?

Shabad OS B.translation: : Guru Hargobind the enlightened is manifest of Lord. He is granter of spiritual knowledge.

lines.gurmukhi: gur goibMd bKwnIAY nwm doie pRB eyk ]2]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Gur Gobind Bakhaaneeai , Naam Doi Prabh Ayk ?2?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru and Gobind are just two separate names, but in reality it is Lord Himself who is manifest.

lines.gurmukhi: nwm doie pRB eyk tyk gurmuiK ThrweI
lines.transliteration_english: Naam Doi Prabh Ayka , Tayk Gurmukhi Tthaharaaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Guru and Gobind though are two different names, in reality He himself is refulgent

lines.gurmukhi: Awid Bey gur nwm duqIAw goibMd bfweI
lines.transliteration_english: Aadi Bhaay Gur Naama , Douteeaa Gobind Badaaee ?

Shabad OS B.translation: Sikhs ever in attendance of Guru has this strong belief that, first He was called Guru Arjan and then he gave this honour of Guruship to Hargobind.

lines.gurmukhi: hir gur hirgoibMd rcn ric Qwip EQwpn
lines.transliteration_english: Hari Gur Harigobinda , Rachan Rachi Daapi Aodaapan ?

Shabad OS B.translation: God Lord is Guru Arjan Himself and then He Himself became Hargobind.

lines.gurmukhi: pUrn bHm ibbyk pRgt huie Awpw Awpn ]3]7]
lines.transliteration_english: Pooran Braham Bibayka , Pragat Hui Aapaa Aapan ?3?7?

Shabad OS B.translation: The Omnipotent Lord who created the cosmos, established it and has singular authority of destroying it; it seems He Himself has taken the form of Hargobind to reveal all knowledge about Himself. (7)
